favourite.article: God Himself became a man, so that we might live in Him. For us He was crucified, for the many one Man died, He arose from victory, from the grave triumphantly. Now in resurection He as the Spirit lives in us. Call on Him from deep within, Just by calling He comes in, once you call upon His name, nevermore you'll be the same........." Brothers and sisters in Christ from all over the world, how great is His love towards us, as His beloved children".
Just by calling He comes in! We give our all to Him!
Lord Jesus thank You that Your foe when he killed You could only release the flow. Satan has no power because we are filled with the living God. Thank You that we are men of God.

The gospel of John reveals that Christ is the Word, the eternal God (1:1), who passed through a long process eventually to become the breath, the pneuma, that He might enter into the believers. For the accomplishment of God's eternal purpose, He took 2 steps. First, He took the step of incarnation to become a man in the flesh (1:14), to become the Lamb of God to accomplish redemption for man (1:29), to declare God to man (1:18), and to manifest the Father to His believers (14:9-11). Second, He took the step of death and resurrection to be transfigured into the Spirit that He might impart Himself into His believers as their life and everything for the building of His Body, the church, the habitation of God, to express the Triune God for eternity.
It is for this very reason I give myself to Him by calling on His name. By calling on Him, I enjoy Him anytime and anywhere! Oh Lord Jesus!!!!!!! I love You!!!!
Praise the Lord, God sent His Son! Hallelujah!
Praise the Lord God sent His Son.
Calling on His name is the simplest way for us to enjoy Him and give our whole being to Him.
God sent His only begotten Son... For our Salvation. So that we might live in Him. That's why we must LOVE Him and Give our all to Him!!!
Praise the Lord! Just by calling, He comes in! Every day, we are becoming His very duplications on earth! We are being made into this glorious, wonderful One!
